intro: Gossypium convexum, commonly known as the African cotton tree, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers. The plant produces fluffy, white cotton-like fibers that are used in traditional textiles. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it can grow up to 10 meters tall.
